channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: 34 Volunteers From Around the World Will Help NASA Track the Artemis 2 Mission
item.description: The list includes volunteers ranging from amateur radio enthusiasts to commercial service providers.

item.title: Rugged mobile NAS with an integrated tablet goes on sale for $1,599: UnifyDrive UP6 has a Core Ultra CPU, up to 96GB RAM, 10GbE LAN, support for eGPU and up to 48TB SSD storage
item.description: Rugged mobile NAS with integrated touchscreen goes on sale for $1,599, combining portable flash storage, battery backup, and local AI features.

item.title: Social network UpScrolled sees surge in downloads following TikTok’s US takeover
item.description: UpScrolled's TikTok alternative is climbing up the App Store's top charts.

item.title: ‘Looney Tunes’ Has Found a New Home: Turner Classic Movies
item.description: TCM will celebrate the shorts' arrival with a marathon starring Bugs Bunny.

item.title: The best Bluetooth trackers for Apple and Android phones
item.description: Some people rarely lose things. Wallets are always exactly where they’re supposed to be, keys never go missing, and remotes never slip between the couch cushions. And then there’s the rest of us — the folks who can’t ever seem to find the thing that was right there a few seconds ago. For us, there […]

item.title: Blue Beetle director would ‘definitely’ return to the live-action DC universe — but The Wrecking Crew 2 could land on Prime Video much sooner
item.description: Blue Beetle was the DC movie that never fulfilled its full potential. But with the director now behind the new Prime Video movie The Wrecking Crew, there's a good chance we'll see a return to both.

item.title: OpenAI’s president is a Trump mega-donor
item.description: OpenAI's co-founder and longtime president, Greg Brockman, didn't just make a run-of-the-mill donation to the main pro-Trump super PAC - together, he and his wife Anna's September 2025 donations equaled the largest of them all, totaling $25 million to "MAGA Inc.," per a recent filing. The Brockmans' donations made up nearly one-fourth of the six-month […]...

item.title: Rad Power Bikes reaches deal to sell itself for $13.2 million
item.description: A company called Life Electric Vehicle Holdings has emerged as the top bidder for Rad Power's assets. It's not clear what the company plans to do with them, though.

item.title: Tech Workers Demand CEOs Use Their ‘Leverage’ to End ICE Violence
item.description: Big tech helped get us into this situation. Workers want it to help get us out, starting with canceling ICE contracts.

item.title: Android 17 Might Copy the Worst Thing About iOS 26
item.description: You probably already know what it is.

item.title: Redditors Are Mounting a Resistance Against ICE
item.description: A user from r/Minneapolis was among the first to share footage of federal agents shooting Alex Pretti. Following his death, subreddits about football, cats, and embroidery have all rallied against ICE.

item.title: Google will settle its Assistant spying lawsuit for $68 million
item.description: Google could owe you some money, now that it's moving to settle a class-action lawsuit over how it handled recordings captured when its devices were activated by something other than Google Assistant's actual trigger word, "Ok Google." German outlet VRT NWS's 2019 report exposed the issue, and court filings from last Friday say the proposed […]

item.title: Apple’s luxe AirPods Max have dropped to one of their lowest prices ever
item.description: If you prefer over-ear headphones to earbuds and own an iPhone or another Apple device, the AirPods Max with USB-C are worth a look, especially now that you can buy them at Best Buy as part of a flash deal for $429.99 ($120 off) through tomorrow, January 27th. That’s $30 shy of their lowest price […]

item.title: Claude Code's 'Tasks' update lets agents work longer and coordinate across sessions
item.description: One of the biggest constraints currently facing AI builders who want to deploy agents in service of their individual or enterprise goals is the "working memory" required to manage complex, multi-stage engineering projects.Typically, when a AI agent operates purely on a stream of text or voice-based conversation, it lacks the structural permanence to handle dependencies. It knows what to do, but it often forgets why it is doing it, or in what order.With the release of Tasks for Claude Code (introduced in v2.1.16) last week, Anthropic has introduced a solution that is less about "AI magic" and m...

item.title: We Finally Know When SpaceX Might Fly the Biggest Version of Starship Yet
item.description: The megarocket's highly-anticipated 12th test flight is tentatively scheduled for early March.

item.title: Ubisoft proposes even more layoffs after last week's studio closures and game cancellations
item.description: It looks like Ubisoft is planning even more layoffs to accompany last week's studio closures and game cancellations, according to reporting by IGN. The company is planning a massive reduction of the workforce in its Paris headquarters. It has proposed the loss of up to 200 jobs, which is nearly 20 percent of the current staff. This will be organized under France's Rupture Conventionnelle Collective (RCC) process, in which staff can agree to form a collective, voluntary mutual termination agreement. It's not a done deal just yet, with a company spokesperson saying "at this stage, this remains a...

item.title: LLM Brainrot Is Here: Grokipedia Is Starting to Show Up in ChatGPT Citations
item.description: GPT-5.2 is "learning" from Musk’s AI-generated version of Wikipedia.

item.title: The 10 Best Sleep Masks We’ve Tested While Snoozing (2026)
item.description: Get some solid shut-eye with the help of these sleep masks. Our top pick is from Blissy.

item.title: Lego’s New ‘Lord of the Rings’ Set Celebrates the Dark Lord Himself
item.description: Lego's ventures into Middle-earth are coming along more often—and at lower prices.

item.title: AI startup CVector raises $5M for its industrial ‘nervous system’
item.description: Now, founders Richard Zhang and Tyler Ruggles are tasked with a bigger challenge: showing customers and investors how this AI-powered software layer translates to real savings on an industrial scale.

item.title: KitchenAid trends for 2026: give your kitchen an upgrade with smart accessories and attachments from just $9
item.description: Add a splash of color to your cooking space with bright and cheery accessories for your favorite stand mixer.

item.title: What Google just did to Nest is the 1 thing no company should ever do
item.description: Because technology is apparently obligated to continue to march on, Google says that the oldest Nest Thermostats are basically obsolete. Back in October, Google ended software support for the original and second-generation Nest Learning Thermostats. On the surface, that doesn’t seem totally unreasonable, considering those original devices are roughly 14 years old at this point. If you have one, you can still use it as a thermostat, but it will no longer connect to the internet. As a result, you can’t connect to it using the Nest or Google Home apps....

item.title: OpenAI could take down Google’s $260 billion ad empire. Here’s how
item.description: Hint: It involves better targeting Ads already follow you wherever you go. They’re on your TV, your phone, your train car–even on your airline tray table and escalator.

item.title: Saudi Arabia’s Futuristic Megacity Runs Into Dilemma: Why Build Housing When You Can Build a Data Center?
item.description: The Line is shrinking.

item.title: Cette manette polyvalente au look rétro style Super Nintendo est affichée à prix cassé
item.description: La 8BitDo SN30 Pro est une manette sans‑fil compacte à l’esthétique rétro inspirée de la Super Nintendo, qui tombe à 29 euros alors qu’on la trouve plutôt aux alentours de 40 euros habituellement, ce qui en fait une vraie bonne affaire pour les joueurs console, PC ou mobile.
